title: Russia military drone 'spotted over German nuclear power plant' sparking WWIII fears
text: WW3 fears explode as Russian drones spotted over key EU infrastructure Insiders have raised the alarm about a Russian military drone possibly flying over a German nuclear power plant, signaling another act of Kremlin espionage that has caused concern for the west. The incident involved an "enemy object" hovering over the shut-down facility and a natural gas terminal in Brunsbuttel, Schleswig-Holstein, according to Bild. The publication also noted that several other drones were seen nearby recently. An internal police report was quoted by Bild: "The no-fly zone was violated several times by flying over the nuclear power plant. An enemy object, believed to be a military drone, was captured." Sources suggest the drone likely came from Russia and might have been sent from civilian vessels in the North Sea. The Flensburg public prosecutor's office is looking into the possibility of a sabotage attempt. There have also been sightings of unidentified drones over German military bases where Ukrainian forces are being trained. Marcus Faber, a member of the German parliament, expressed his concerns to Bild in January, saying, "Drones are regularly spotted over the Klietz military training area, where the Bundeswehr (German military) trains Ukrainians (on Leopard 1 tank)." Mr Faber implied that Russia was responsible for these occurrences and highlighted Germany's urgent need for better drone technology and modern jamming equipment. German politician, Andreas Schwarz, has voiced his concerns over Russia's potential spying activities, stating: "We must not allow Russia to spy on military training areas with drones." By the end of August 2023, Germany had trained at least 6,000 Ukrainian soldiers, with a target of 10,000 by year-end. The training programs have included general combat training and the use of advanced equipment such as Patriot air defence systems and US-supplied Abrams tanks.
